content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-254-03-B
|Item_parent=Nutritional needs of pregnant women
|Item_parent_short=Nutritional needs of pregnant women
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing how to prevent spina bifida
|Description=Vitamin B9
|Rubric=Physiopathology
|Contributors=
|Order=3}}
Folic acid (vitamin B9) supplementation is systematically recommended at a rate of 400 µg/d, 28 days before conception and up to 12 weeks gestation.

question.question: When is folic acid (vitamin B9) supplementation recommended to prevent spina bifida?
question.option_a: Starting from the first day of pregnancy until 12 weeks gestation
question.option_b: Starting 28 days before conception and continuing until 12 weeks gestation
question.option_c: Starting 14 days before conception and continuing until 8 weeks gestation
question.option_d: Starting 28 days before conception and continuing until 8 weeks gestation
